item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2010/05/22/arthur-green-%e2%80%93-radical-judaism-5/#comment-1033">ej</a>.
We used to be ancient people of the Bible, then medieval people of metaphysics and theism, now we have God as energy. It means that we have to accept this new universal thinking. I am beginning to get a sense that it is less what Green means but more why people find that this resonates with them.

item.title: By: ej
item.dc:creator: ej
item.description: I don't understand how Green can think he is anywhere close in his understanding of the world to the model proposed by evolution? What could a sentence like "we need to internalize that man is the image of God" possibly mean? When do we introduce God, however understood, into the evolutionary story.
